comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Seems to have been a North Carolina clubwoman.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: She was engaged in social work on a large scale, as a district leader of both North and South Carolina. Her husband was a wealthy cotton manufacturer who owned mills, warehouses and water power in the vicinity of Spray, N. C. Mebane also was a breeder of Hereford cattle. Mr. Mebane was a confidant and correspondent of Booker T. Washington, advising him that the negro needed to develop an economic stake in the cotton crop, to become more than a mere cotton picker or mill hand.
